summary:
## The Mandelbrot Set: A Zoomable Wonder

The Mandelbrot set is a cool mathematical shape that looks complex but is defined by a simple rule. It's made of numbers that don't get infinitely big when you apply a certain math operation over and over. 

When you zoom in, it reveals tiny, detailed patterns that repeat forever.  This makes it a "fractal," like a tiny snowflake within a snowflake.  People like looking at Mandelbrot images because they're beautiful and surprising.
title: Mandelbrot set
